articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
I’m Muhammad. I work as a data analyst/scientist at Exact in the Netherlands. Before that I worked as a researcher at the University of Twente.
My website is built using the {distill} package. Before that I used Hugo and the blogdown package for my website.

articles.title: Data Science Posts
articles.description: A collection of my data science-related posts.
articles.contents:
R Markdown
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  

Including Plots
You can also embed plots, for example:



Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

            Welcome to my personal site!
            Welcome to my personal site! I’m a data analyst based in
            the Netherlands, working in the financial and business
            software industry. While Python is my primary work tool,
            love language is R, especially when it comes to creating
            visualizations.

articles.title: Photography Posts

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
TidyTuesday


My Submissions for the weekly TidyTuesday Project created using R and ggplot()






{Delgosha}


An R package which aims to provide a collection of
ggplot2 themes for RTL languages (mostly Persian)






{palmerpenguins}


A python package for easily loading the Palmer penguins into your python environment
